text.base: The path dissolves into a slurry of clay and pine needles. The canopy knits together overhead—a ceiling, not a sky. The air tastes metallic. Ozone and old pennies.

lens.believer: The wind dies here. Not stopped—removed. The stillness is artificial. Something is listening to your heartbeat.
lens.skeptic: Tire tracks. Heavy tread, military grade, partially washed away. Too wide for a ranger vehicle. Someone drove a deuce-and-a-half through here recently.
lens.haunted: There's a fence post to your left. Barbed wire cut clean. You remember the sound of wire cutters. Keep moving. Don't look at the post.

inserts.text: A heavy canvas toolbag sits near the treeline, half-buried in pine needles. It's covered in frost. Stenciled on the side in white paint: 'MAINTENANCE - T. MHLLER'. The 'I' has been scratched out.

memory_trigger.text: A flash: Men in hazmat suits. The hiss of a sprayer. They weren't planting trees. They were painting them.

choices.label: Follow the path North to the Radio Tower
